The course structure for MBA is designed to create industry ready professionals equipped with significant knowledge, principles, positive outlook, attitude and skills to occupy positions of management and administration in the corporate world. SVIMS offers specializations in the field of Marketing, Finance and Human Resource. The admissions are through a highly competitive and an online computer-based test followed by Group Discussion (GD) & Personal Interview (PI) conducted by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), India. College: St Claret College, Bangalore
Approval: UGC
Eligiblity: Applicants need to have 50% or above marks in aggregate in the qualifying undergraduate/postgraduate examination from any recognized university. Those in the final year of their studies should have 50% or above aggregate in all the Semesters/years of undergraduate examinations conducted so far. Even if an offer of admission is given to such candidates, it will be only provisional and will be automatically canceled if the candidate fails in the examination or fails to obtain 50% marks in the aggregate.l. Entrance Test scores accepted:l. A minimum MAT score of 500l. A minimum XAT score of 50 percentileWe also accept GMAT, CAT, ATMA and CMAT scores
Course_Detail: The MBA program of St. Claret College (SCC) equips the students to make a confident entry into the corporate world through its program offering, extra-curricular agenda, international linkages, and campus placements. Apart from the robust internship programs with companies, the mentoring by SCC's dedicated team of full-time faculty members and visiting faculty rich in academic and industry experience helps the students to get a balanced exposure to research, academics and practical aspects of the industry. The aim of the two-year program is to develop holistic and veritable professionals, ready to jumpstart their career in the corporate world. This aim is achieved by imparting a blend of academic and co-curricular skills, with a tinge of social sensitivity. Besides the requisite managerial skills, our students also attain social, entrepreneurial and leadership skills. A very important parameter of success for any B-School is its ability to offer the corporate interface for its students, which enhances their practical knowledge to face the corporate world. SCC, with its long-standing history of over a decade in the field of professional management education, has built strong partnerships with the corporate world, providing training for staff, collaborating on research & development programs, consultancy assignments, and corporate projects. SCC strives to build up industry relevant interfaces by conducting workshops, topical seminars, special lectures, soft skills training and industrial visits for its students to expose them to the realms of the corporate environment. Management Development Programs (MDPs) are an integral part of SCC's activities aimed at developing its interaction with the corpo

In response to the acute need of the corporate world, CK College of Engineering & Technology offers a 2 year full time MBA Program. In this program the students are given a chance to learn more and gain experience through regular Industrial visits, Corporate Interactions and In-Plant training. We focus on case study based learning and Guest Lectures are arranged via satellite connection from Premier management institutes like IIM. Our vision is to increase business acumen and enhance the skill set of students and help them to view things in Business Perspective. Our Ultimate aim is to produce industry- ready managers and Young Entrepreneurs. The institute has well qualified and experienced faculties in MBA department. The department is very frequently inviting senior level managers from our corporate for interacting with our students. We are planning to provide industrial training to the students and faculty in every semester in order to learn the application of management practices. Our department has air-conditioned class rooms, internet connectivity and video conferencing hall for enabling guest lecture from our corporate. Candidates securing Non-Zero Positive marks/score in MAH-MBA/MMS-CET or GMAT/CAT/ MAT/ATMA/ XAT/ CMAT (Conducted by AICTE) / Association CET/ Any other equivalent CET will be eligible to get admission to MBA/MMS course in the State of Maharashtra.

College: Viva Institute of Management and Research, Virar
Approval: (AICTE) All India Council of Technical Education
Eligiblity: 1. Eligibility Criteria In order to seek admission to MMS degree program candidate have to fulfill Educational Requirements as well as Entrance Test requirements, as specified below (A) Educational Qualifications: Passed with minimum of 50% marks in aggregate* or equivalent CGPA ( 45% in case of candidates of backward class categories and Persons With Disability belonging to Maharashtra State only) in any Bachelor’s degree awarded by any of the Universities incorporated by an act of the central or state legislature in India or other educational institutions established by an act of Parliament or declared to be deemed as a University under Section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956 of minimum three years duration in any discipline recognized by the Association of Indian Universities, or possess an equivalent qualification recognized by the Ministry of HRD, Government of India. OR Appeared** for the final year examination of any Bachelor’s degree to be awarded by any of the Universities incorporated by an act of the central or state legislature in India or other educational institutions established by an act of Parliament or declared to be deemed as University under Section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956 of minimum three years duration in any discipline recognised by the Association of Indian Universities, or an equivalent qualification recognized bythe Ministry of HRD, Government of India. Such candidates can be considered for provisional admission subject to passing the Degree exam with minimum of 50% marks in aggregate* or equivalent CGPA (45% in case of candidates of backward class categories and Persons With Disability belonging to Maharashtra State only) (B) Entrance Test Requirements: Appeared for GMAT (conducted by GMAC, USA)/ CAT (conducted by IIMs)/ MAT(conducted by AIMA)/ ATMA(conducted by AIMS)/XAT (conducted by XLRI) / CMAT for the respective year OR Appeared for MAH‐MBA/MMS‐CET for the respective year OR Appeared for CET conducted by the agency (including Association of all colleges of a particular type in the State) approved by Pravesh Niyantran Samiti, Bandra (E), Mumbai‐51 for the academic year (C) Eligibility Criteria for admission against Institute Level Seats: Candidate should be an Indian National and should possess basic qualification as specified above AND Appeared for GMAT (conducted by GMAC, USA)/ CAT (conducted by IIMs)/ MAT(conducted by AIMA)/ ATMA(conducted by AIMS)/XAT (conducted by XLRI) / CMAT for the respective year OR Appeared for MAH‐MBA/MMS‐CET 2014 for the respective year OR Appeared for CET conducted by the agency (including Association of all colleges of a particular type in the State) approved by Pravesh Niyantran Samiti, Bandra (E), Mumbai‐51 for the academic year 2.Selection basis and Selection Procedure adopted for admission through CAP: (A). Assignment of merit number for all students registered for CAP: Maharashtra State Seats Admission through Centralised admission process (CAP) based on a State level Merit Number assigned based on the percentile obtained in MAH-MBA/MMS CET for the respective year . All India Seats Admission through Centralised admission process (CAP) where each All India candidate who has appeared in CAT 2014 (conducted by IIMs)/CMAT (Conducted by AICTE) / GMAT (conducted by GMAC, USA)/ MAT/ XAT (conducted by XLRI)/ ATMA (conducted by AIMS)/ MAH-MBA/MMS-CET for the respective year will be assigned a State level merit number on the basis of percentile mentioned on the score card. (B). CAP round : For the academic year, the Competent Authority shall conduct total three (3) rounds of Centralized Admission. The CAP shall consist of first two (2) rounds by Centralized Allotment wherein eligible candidates will fill separate Online Option forms for respective rounds. Third round of CAP shall be conducted by way of counseling only for the eligible Maharashtra State candidates.
